content: knitted in the round this is a simple and straightforward knit for a set of half-mitts the mock rib pattern gives some stretch like a rib stitch but it is faster at round 19 you have a choice to make a simple thumb opening or to set stitches aside for a knitted thumb they are a great project for hand spun yarns requiring about 60 gram 2 ounces and 100 - 120 yards of dk weight yarn to get different sizes i simply changed my needle size from 2 75mm for small 3 25mm for medium 3 5mm for large yarn 60 grams 2 oz of dk yarn needles 3 25mm or 3 5mm dpn double pointed needles tapestry needle waste yarn scissors size women s medium to make it larger use slightly larger needles 3 5mm to make a smaller mitt use 2 75 needles gauge a mitten is a swatch
